page.title: 15Glastonbury -An infant's day
page.content: Mummy and I leave home at 8.30a.m.and walk half a mile to school. The bell rings at 8.50a.m. and then we all go into school. There are eight classes and we have about thirty children in each class. During the morning I do some writing, draw pictures, read and do number work. I like to use the computer. In the playground we have lots of apparatus to climb and swing on. When it is fine and the grass is dry we can play on the paddock. From April to October we have swimming lessons in our own indoor pool. In the afternoons we can choose what we do. I like painting and making junk models, or using the construction toys. Sometimes I dress up and play in the Wendy House. Our school is called St. John's, and the junior school is St. Benedict's. The big children go to St. Dunstan's.
